keyMoments.title: Attacked by Garp for Pirate Dreams
keyMoments.description: Luffy, along with Ace and Sabo, receives a brutal beating from Garp for still wanting to become pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's unwavering commitment to his dream despite opposition from his powerful grandfather.

keyMoments.title: Decision to Run Away
keyMoments.description: Luffy and his brothers decide to run away from Dadan's home and survive on their own rather than give up their pirate dreams.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's independence and determination at a young age.
keyMoments.quote: We will stand on our own feet!

keyMoments.title: Building the Pirate Ship Hideout
keyMoments.description: Luffy helps build an elaborate treehouse hideout designed to look like a pirate ship.
keyMoments.significance: The hideout symbolizes the brothers' shared dream and their independence.

keyMoments.title: Hugging Makino
keyMoments.description: When Makino visits, Luffy immediately runs to her and hugs her, showing their close bond.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the maternal/sisterly relationship between Luffy and Makino from his childhood.

relationships.description: Makino serves as a maternal/sisterly figure to young Luffy. He shows great affection for her, immediately hugging her when she visits.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy immediately hugs Makino when she comes to visit, showing their close bond.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Attacked by Garp for Pirate Dreams
keyMoments.description: Young Ace receives a beating from Garp along with his brothers for wanting to become pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's determination to pursue his dream despite his grandfather's opposition.

keyMoments.title: Building the Hideout
keyMoments.description: Ace helps gather materials from Gray Terminal and construct the pirate ship hideout.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ace's resourcefulness and cooperation with his brothers.

keyMoments.title: Designing Booby Traps
keyMoments.description: Ace designs and sets up elaborate Rube Goldberg-style booby traps around the hideout.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's strategic thinking and protective nature toward their hideout.

keyMoments.title: Attacked by Garp for Pirate Dreams
keyMoments.description: Young Sabo is beaten by Garp along with Luffy and Ace for wanting to become a pirate.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sabo's commitment to his dream despite the consequences.

keyMoments.title: Designing the Pirate Ship Hideout
keyMoments.description: Sabo uses his exceptional design skills to create the blueprint for the elaborate treehouse hideout that resembles a pirate ship.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Sabo's intelligence and design abilities, as well as his contribution to the brothers' shared dream.

reveals.information: Sabo possesses exceptional design and engineering skills, able to create detailed blueprints for complex structures

keyMoments.title: Worrying About the Brothers
keyMoments.description: When the boys don't return home during a storm, Dadan becomes increasingly worried and sends her bandits to search for them, revealing her true caring nature.
keyMoments.significance: This is a key character development moment for Dadan, showing that beneath her rough exterior, she genuinely cares for the boys as a mother figure.
keyMoments.quote: Where are those brats? They should have come back by now!

keyMoments.title: Triggering the Booby Trap
keyMoments.description: Dadan finds the brothers' hideout and accidentally triggers Ace's elaborate trap, getting hit with a mallet.
keyMoments.significance: A comedic moment that also shows Dadan cared enough to personally search for the boys.

keyMoments.title: Nightmare of the Luffy Fairy
keyMoments.description: Dadan has a nightmare where a 'Luffy Fairy' appears, showing how the three troublesome boys have stretched her sanity to breaking point.
keyMoments.significance: A humorous moment that emphasizes both her exasperation and underlying affection for the boys.

relationships.description: Dadan serves as a reluctant guardian and mother figure to Luffy. Despite her rough exterior, she deeply cares for him and worries about his safety.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan's worry when the boys don't return reveals the depth of her maternal feelings for them.

relationships.description: Dadan serves as a reluctant guardian and mother figure to Ace, caring for him despite her gruff demeanor.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan's frantic search for the boys shows she sees Ace as one of her own.

relationships.description: Dadan serves as a reluctant guardian and mother figure to Sabo, worrying about his wellbeing along with the other two boys.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan includes Sabo in her worried search, treating him as family.

reveals.information: Despite her rough, violent exterior and constant complaints, Dadan genuinely cares for Luffy, Ace, and Sabo as a mother would, worrying about their safety and wellbeing

keyMoments.title: Attacking the Brothers for Their Pirate Dreams
keyMoments.description: Garp discovers the three brothers still want to be pirates and attacks them with his brutal training methods.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the conflict between Garp's Marine values and his grandsons' pirate ambitions, and his harsh approach to trying to change their minds.
keyMoments.quote: You're still saying you want to be pirates?!

keyMoments.title: Visiting Luffy at Mt. Colubo
keyMoments.description: Makino visits Luffy at Mt. Colubo along with Mayor Woop Slap. Luffy immediately runs to her and hugs her.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the close maternal/sisterly bond between Makino and young Luffy.

relationships.description: Makino has a sisterly and protective relationship with Luffy, serving as a maternal figure during his childhood. She cares deeply for him and supports his dreams.

evolutionMoments.description: Young Luffy's immediate affectionate hug when seeing Makino shows the warmth of their relationship.
